location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 28 of 1867 from Lewis Pelly, Political Resident Persian Gulf, Bushire to Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter regarding a Government resolution requiring Pelly to advise on the means of supplying knowledge of native languages to the Naval service; supporting Government's thoughts on introducing an interpreters' allowance and giving some more general thoughts on the Naval presence in the East.
